citations.title: Ohne Titel
citations.summary: The BMW Group is implementing sustainable practices by proactively eliminating specific chemicals from its vehicle production processes. This commitment reflects the company's dedication to environmental responsibility and safety in manufacturing.

citations.title: DISCOVER THE BMW i3.
citations.summary: The BMW i3 features an optional heat pump system that automatically activates to enhance energy efficiency by extracting heat from the surrounding air. This technology helps to optimize the vehicle's thermal management, contributing to improved performance and range.

citations.title: Dawn of an electric era
citations.summary: The BMW 1602 Electric featured a removable battery pack weighing 771 pounds (350 kg), powered by 12 standard 12-volt lead-acid batteries from VARTA, which supplied energy to an 85-kilogram electric motor. This setup allowed the vehicle to accelerate from 0 to 50 km/h in eight seconds, reach a top speed of 100 km/h, and achieve a range of up to 60 kilometers at a constant speed of 50 km/h. The electric motor, a Bosch DC shunt-wound type with a peak output of 32 kilowatts, transmitted power to the rear wheels through an intermediate gearing and prop shaft.

citations.title: Busting electric car myths
citations.summary: BMW has committed to reducing CO2 emissions in Europe by sourcing electricity exclusively from renewable sources for the production of its electric vehicles, such as the i3. Starting in 2020, the company will eliminate the use of rare earth materials and reduce cobalt sourcing to Australia and Morocco, emphasizing control over its supply chain and adherence to environmental and human rights standards. Additionally, BMW aims to enhance battery recyclability and explore options for repurposing batteries to extend their lifecycle.

citations.title: BMW Electric Future | BMW.com
citations.summary: The article discusses BMW's commitment to an electric future, highlighting their advancements in electric vehicle technology and infrastructure. It emphasizes the development of high-performance electric drivetrains, battery efficiency, and the integration of sustainable materials in vehicle production. Additionally, BMW outlines its strategy for expanding its electric vehicle lineup and enhancing charging solutions to support widespread adoption.

citations.title: A touch of the future with BMW
citations.summary: BMW's advanced seating technology integrates sensors and artificial intelligence to enhance passenger comfort and health. The system can identify unhealthy postures or orthopedic issues, automatically adjusting the seating position for optimal support. Additionally, it monitors the occupant's temperature, responding to conditions like sweating or shivering by regulating the climate for each body zone individually.
